content.body: one thing that's unclear to me is what operations FullDecimal (I don't like the name but work with me) should support

that's my only (weak) objection -- no clear use cases, it exists mainly for the purpose of abstract language niceness

IEEE 754 has a comparison that respects the precision (quantum) but it's really weird

yeah it's very weird to compare precision

you can detect that two values are mathematically equal but distinct if you have toString

I think FullDecimal should either do a total comparison or it should not have an equals function

content.body: My preferred solution for precision would be for Amount to include a `significantDigits` field. That class already includes an optional unit or currency indicator that needs to be accounted for by any operations on it. Adding precision to it as a third thing (beyond value + dimension) is a much smaller cost than adding a second thing to Decimal.
content.formatted_body: My preferred solution for precision would be for Amount to include a significantDigits field. That class already includes an optional unit or currency indicator that needs to be accounted for by any operations on it. Adding precision to it as a third thing (beyond value + dimension) is a much smaller cost than adding a second thing to Decimal.

content.body: That also allows for Amount to solve by itself the i18n issues around precision, rather than relying on the committee finding agreement on how and whether to include that within the Decimal proposal work.

On API details: Is there any reason why Amount ought to include a secondary constructor like `Amount.from()`? I think Shane's slide 6 alludes to that, but it's not clear to me why that might be desirable over `new Amount()` supporting the same inputs as might be proposed for `Amount.from()`.
content.formatted_body: On API details: Is there any reason why Amount ought to include a secondary constructor like Amount.from()? I think Shane's slide 6 alludes to that, but it's not clear to me why that might be desirable over new Amount() supporting the same inputs as might be proposed for Amount.from().

content.body: While Ben is on leave, Jesse will be responsible for working on Measure/Amount/Decimal-related tasks, and the remaining tasks will be distributed among other team members, who can also provide support in other tasks if needed

Temporal sets precedent for `new` being strict to the data model and `.from` taking things that get coerced. But this is a nitpick that the champions should resolve. Doesn't have to do with proposal motivation.
content.formatted_body: Temporal sets precedent for new being strict to the data model and .from taking things that get coerced. But this is a nitpick that the champions should resolve. Doesn't have to do with proposal motivation.

content.body: Amount is proposed as opaque. The exact fields are not normative at stage 2.
Sure, but e.g. on your slide 5 (data model) the currency/unit is specifically mentioned, but significantDigits is not.

"new being strict to the data model and .from taking things that get coerced" sounds like a language design concept that ought to get explicitly discussed in committee, separately from either Temporal or Amount.
Do you think new vs .from needs to be discussed before stage 2?

eemeli: The purpose of this presentation is to identify issues that could _block advancement to Stage 2_. Your comments are good things to discuss amongst the champions, but they do not strike me as the type of thing that need to be resolved before Stage 2.
content.formatted_body: eemeli: The purpose of this presentation is to identify issues that could block advancement to Stage 2. Your comments are good things to discuss amongst the champions, but they do not strike me as the type of thing that need to be resolved before Stage 2.

content.body: I am seeking feedback on _the shape of the solution_ being a new type called Amount with semantics that is a wrapper over a numeric type with precision and a unit and extremely limited functionality. I think we are in furious agreement on that.
content.formatted_body: I am seeking feedback on the shape of the solution being a new type called Amount with semantics that is a wrapper over a numeric type with precision and a unit and extremely limited functionality. I think we are in furious agreement on that.

content.body: I don't think .from vs. new is a blocking concern; I'm really just pointing out that it ought to be discussed in general, separately from either Temporal or Amount.
